and.name: Operations
and.description: Represents the operations that can be applied to the comparison and integration of models and schemas. This includes matching, mapping, and alignment processes.

and.name: Matching
and.description: Defines the process of identifying correspondences between models or schemas.

and.name: Matching Unit
and.description: Represents the different units or approaches used in the matching process.

or.name: Structural
or.description: Focuses on matching based on the structure of models or schemas. Select exactly one approach.

feature.name: Graph
feature.description: Matching based on graph structures in the models or schemas.

feature.name: Syntactic / Linguistic
feature.description: Matching based on the syntactic or linguistic aspects of the models or schemas.

feature.name: Tree/Textual
feature.description: Matching based on tree structures or textual representations.

or.name: Semantic
or.description: Focuses on matching based on the semantic meaning of the data. Select exactly one approach.

feature.name: Instance-based
feature.description: Matching based on instances or data objects in the models or schemas.

feature.name: DSL-Driven
feature.description: Matching based on domain-specific languages (DSLs) used in the models or schemas.

feature.name: Knowledge Graph
feature.description: Matching based on knowledge graph structures.

feature.name: Ontology-based
feature.description: Matching based on ontologies and their relationships within models or schemas.

alt.name: Similarity
alt.description: Focuses on matching based on the similarity of elements in the models or schemas. Select exactly one approach.

feature.name: Element
feature.description: Matching based on the similarity of individual elements in the models or schemas.

feature.name: Name
feature.description: Matching based on the similarity of names in the models or schemas.

feature.name: Value
feature.description: Matching based on the similarity of values in the models or schemas.

and.name: Correspondence
and.description: Describes the nature and characteristics of relationships between elements.

or.name: Components
or.description: Classifies the types of elements we are matching.

alt.name: Heterogeneous
alt.description: Elements from different categories are matched.

feature.name: Metamodel
feature.description: Model that defines the language for other models (e.g., UML metamodel).

feature.name: Model
feature.description: Concrete representation of a system (e.g., a specific UML diagram).

feature.name: Instances
feature.description: Concrete data elements that conform to a model.

feature.name: Homogeneous
feature.description: Elements from the same category are matched (e.g., two UML class diagrams).

or.name: Properties
or.description: Describes the qualities or attributes of the matching relationships.

or.name: Arity
or.description: Describes how many elements are involved in a matching relationship.

feature.name: Multi-ary
feature.description: Involves more than two elements in a relationship.

feature.name: Binary
feature.description: Involves exactly two elements in a relationship.

or.name: Authority
or.description: Describes who controls or governs the matching process.

feature.name: Centralised
feature.description: A single entity controls the matching process.

feature.name: Decentralised
feature.description: Multiple entities control the matching process.

or.name: Information Content
or.description: Describes how information is distributed across related elements.

feature.name: Symmetric
feature.description: Elements contain unique, independent information.

feature.name: Asymmetric
feature.description: One element's information is derived from the other.

feature.name: Mapping
feature.description: Defines the process of establishing relationships or transformations between different models or schemas. Mapping depends on the Matching stage.

feature.name: Alignment
feature.description: Defines the process of aligning models or schemas based on common attributes, structures, or semantics. Alignment depends on the Mapping and Matching stages.

and.name: Execution Context
and.description: Defines the environment and circumstances under which the matching, mapping, or alignment process occurs. It describes when and where the operations are executed.

alt.name: Storage
alt.description: Describes where the data related to the matching, mapping, or alignment process is kept.

feature.name: Transient
feature.description: Temporary storage that is discarded after the operation is complete.

alt.name: Persistent
alt.description: Long-term storage where data is kept even after the operation is complete.

feature.name: Cloud-based
feature.description: Data is stored in cloud-based environments for easy access and scalability.

feature.name: Hard-drive
feature.description: Data is stored locally on a hard drive for secure and permanent storage.

feature.name: In-memory
feature.description: Data is stored in-memory for fast access during operation execution.

or.name: Invocation
or.description: Defines how often the matching, mapping, or alignment process is executed.

feature.name: Once
feature.description: The process is executed only one time, typically for a single comparison.

feature.name: Repeated
feature.description: The process is executed multiple times, typically for iterative or ongoing operations.
